comment.author: 7806261@N06
comment._content: Bongaree Jetty, Bribie Island. Same place, same ferry: bishop.slq.qld.gov.au/view/action/singleViewer.do?dvs=137...

comment.author: 67349057@N06
comment._content: It is incorrect to state that this vessel is 'docked'. She is 'alongside'. A dock is where a ship is placed to carry out repairs below the waterline. Robert Carter

comment.author: 59026037@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/67349057@N06] "Docked" can mean both being in a (dry) dock for repairs, or being docked at a pier for loading/unloading passengers, as well as a few other things.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/miniop] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/67349057@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/tveljus] Thanks all for your comments, great sleuthing miniopterus. :)
